doc_class_description: A Court of Appeal judgment is a higher court ruling that reviews decisions of lower courts, shaping legal precedent and protecting citizens’ rights.

latest_doc_d.description: Gunasingha Arachchilage Susantha Kumara alias Ajith Vs. The Hon. Attorney General before Hon. Amal Ranaraja, J.
latest_doc_d.parties: Gunasingha Arachchilage Susantha Kumara alias Ajith Vs. The Hon. Attorney General
latest_doc_d.keywords: Exception 4, Sudden fight exception to the offence of murder - Criteria to be met to invoke the benefit of the exception – Contradictions in the defence – Discrepancies and improbabilities undermine the credibility of the appellant’s testimony
latest_doc_d.legistation: - Section 140, 146, 296 of the Penal Code. - Exception 4 to Section 294 of the Penal Code
